solution_line_template: With a garden hose that fills at a rate of {hose_rate} gallons per minute, and a hole that leaks at {leak_rate} gallons per minute, the net fill rate becomes {hose_rate}-{leak_rate}=<<{hose_rate}-{leak_rate}={net_fill_rate}>>{net_fill_rate} gallons per minute.
Therefore, to fill a {pool_capacity}-gallon pool, it will take {pool_capacity}/{net_fill_rate}=<<{pool_capacity}/{net_fill_rate}={time_to_fill}>>{time_to_fill} minutes.
